contextId.information: Here the metonym "before your eyes" refers to what they saw. AT: "which you yourselves saw" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: before your eyes

contextId.information: Here the metonym "hill country" represents the people that live there. AT: "to attack the people who live in the hill country" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: to attack the hill country

contextId.information: The metonym "hill country" stands for the people who live there. AT: "attacked the people who live in the hill country" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: attacked the hill country

contextId.information: Here the metonym "out of the hand of" means "from the control of." AT: "from the control of the two kings" or "from the two kings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: out of the hand of the two kings

contextId.information: Here the metonym "hand" means control or power. AT: "your power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: your strong hand

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) Moses is calling on all those who live in heaven and earth to be witnesses to what he says or 2) Moses is speaking to heaven and earth as if they are people, and he is calling them to be witnesses to what he says. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: I call heaven and earth to witness

contextId.information: Moses speaks as if the people to whom he was speaking were the people he had spoken to at Mount Sinai many years earlier. The people at Mount Sinai were actually the fathers of the people to whom he was speaking these words. AT: "made your fathers ... your fathers heard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: made you ... you heard

contextId.information: Here the metonym "house of slavery" refers to Egypt where the people of Israel had been slaves. AT: "out of the place where you were slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: out of the house of slavery

contextId.information: The word "voice" is a metonym for the sound of the voice or for the person who was speaking. AT: "heard the sound of the voice" or "heard Yahweh speaking" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: heard the voice

contextId.information: This is a metonym for "all people" or "all living beings." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: all flesh

contextId.information: This is a metonym for "write these words on parchment, put the parchment in a pouch, and tie the pouch." This metonym in turn may be a metaphor for "obey these words so that it is as if they were physically there." AT: "tie these words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: tie them

contextId.information: This is a metonym for "write these words on parchment, put the parchment in a pouch, and tie the pouch to your head so it sits." This metonym in turn may be a metaphor for "obey these words so that it is as if they were physically there." AT: "my words will serve as frontlets"(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: they will serve as frontlets

contextId.information: To swear by the name of Yahweh means to make Yahweh the basis or the power on which the oath is made. The metonym "his name" refers to Yahweh himself. AT: "you will swear and ask Yahweh to confirm it" or "when you swear you will speak his name" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: you will swear by his name

contextId.information: This is a metonym. AT: "he will consider us righteous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: this will be our righteousness

contextId.information: This is a command. Moses speaks as if what the eye sees were the eye itself. AT: "do not allow what you see to cause you to pity them" or "do not pity them because you see that what you are doing is hurting them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: your eye will not pity them

contextId.information: The heart is a symbol of a person's character. AT: "what kind of people you are" or "how you would behave" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what was in your heart

contextId.information: Here "bread" represents all food. AT: "food is not the only thing people need so they can live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: it is not by bread alone that people live

contextId.information: Here "the mouth of Yahweh" is a metonym for the words that Yahweh says. AT: "people must obey the commands of Yahweh so they can live" or "people must do what Yahweh tells them to do so they can live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: it is by everything that proceeds out of the mouth of Yahweh that people live

contextId.information: Here the metonym "heart" represents the thoughts and understanding of a person. AT: "You will understand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: You will think about in your heart

contextId.information: Here "heart" represents the inner person. To become prideful and no longer obey Yahweh is spoken of as if the person's heart is lifted up. AT: "you will become prideful and no longer obey Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: your heart will be lifted up

contextId.information: Here "heart" represents the inner person. To become prideful and no longer obey Yahweh is spoken of as if the person's heart is lifted up. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:08:11|8:12]]. AT: "you become prideful and no longer obey Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: your heart becomes lifted up

contextId.information: This is the third thing the people might do when their hearts "become lifted up" and they "forget Yahweh" ([[:en:bible:notes:deu:08:13|8:14]]). Here "heart" is a metonym for a person's innermost thoughts. AT: "but you may think to yourself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: but you may say in your heart

contextId.information: Here "the voice of Yahweh" means what Yahweh tells his people to do. AT: "would not obey Yahweh's commandments" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: would not listen to the voice of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here the metonym "the word" refers to what God has promised. AT: "so that he may fulfill the promise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: so that he may make come true the word

contextId.information: the golden calf. AT: "the idol you sinned by making" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: your sin

contextId.information: The word "commandment" is a metonym for Yahweh himself. AT: "rebelled against Yahweh; you did not obey the commandment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: rebelled against the commandment

contextId.information: The words "the land" are a metonym for the people of Egypt. AT: "so that the people of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: so that the land from where you brought us

contextId.information: "first" is the  ordinal number for one. It refers to the first set of tablets that Moses had broken. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
contextId.quote: first

contextId.information: Here "first" refers to the first tablets of stone. AT: "just like the first 2 tablets of stone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: like the first

contextId.information: Here "land" represents the people. AT: "to all his people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: to all his land

contextId.information: Here "heart" represents a person's desires or thoughts. This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that your desires do not deceive you" or "so that you do not deceive yourself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that your heart is not deceived

contextId.information: Here "heart" and "soul" represent a person's mind or thoughts. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: your heart and soul

contextId.information: "tie these words." This is a metonymy that represents a person writing the words on a parchment, putting the parchment in a pouch, and tying the pouch. This metonymy in turn may be a metaphor meaning the people must be careful to obey Moses's commands. See how you translated similar phrases in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:06:08|6:8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: bind them

contextId.information: "let my words be as as frontlets between your eyes." This is a metonymy that represents a person writing Moses' words on parchement, putting the parchement in a pouch, and tying the pouch so it sits between his eyes. This metonymy in turn may be a metaphor that means the person must be careful to obey all of Moses' commands. See how you translated similar phrases in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:06:08|6:8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: let them be as frontlets between your eyes

contextId.information: Here "the land" is a metonym for all the people in the land. AT: "upon all the people in every place you go" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: upon all the land that you tread on

contextId.information: Here "days" represents a longer period of time. Also, "live on the earth" is an idiom that means as long as a person lives. AT: "for as long as you live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: all the days that you live on the earth

contextId.information: Here "nations" represents the people groups that live in Canaan. AT: "the people groups whose land you will take" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the nations that you will dispossess

contextId.information: Here "their name" represents "the memory of them." AT: "destroy them so completely that no one will remember them" or "destroy anything that represents these false gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: destroy their name

contextId.information: Here "his name" refers to God himself. Yahweh will choose one location where he will live and people will come to worship him there. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the place that Yahweh your God will choose out of all your tribes to put his name

contextId.information: Here "eyes" represents a person's thoughts or opinions. AT: "everyone is doing what he considers to be right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: now everyone is doing whatever is right in his own eyes

contextId.information: Here "name" refers to God himself. Yahweh would choose a place where he will live and the people will come to worship him. AT: "chooses to dwell" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: chooses to put his name

contextId.information: Here "eyes" represents thoughts or opinions. AT: "what is right according to Yahweh" or "what Yahweh says is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what is right in the eyes of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "words" represents what Moses is saying. AT: "Carefully listen to and obey everything that I am commanding you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Observe and listen to all these words that I command you

contextId.information: Here "words" represent what is said. AT: "do not listen to what that prophet say nor to what the dreamer of dreams says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: do not listen to the words of that prophet, or to that dreamer of dreams

contextId.information: Here "voice" represents what Yahweh says. AT: "you are obeying what Yahweh says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: you are listening to the voice of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "eyes" represents thoughts or opinions. AT: "which is right according to Yahweh your God" or "what Yahweh your God considers to be right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: which is right in the eyes of Yahweh your God

contextId.information: Here "heart" represents a person's mind. AT: "not to think a wicked thought" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: not to have a wicked thought in your heart, saying

contextId.information: Here "Passover" represents the animal that is sacrificed for the Passover celebration. AT: For the Passover you will offer a sacrifice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: You will sacrifice the Passover

contextId.information: Here "Passover" represents the animal that will be sacrificed. AT: "For the Passover you may not sacrifice the animal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: You may not sacrifice the Passover

contextId.information: Here, "in the sight of Yahweh" means what Yahweh considers or thinks about something. AT: "something that Yahweh your God thinks is evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what is evil in the sight of Yahweh your God

contextId.information: Here "the mouth" represents the testimony of a witness. This can be translated in active form.  AT: "If two or three witnesses speak against the person, then you must execute him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
contextId.quote: At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, will he who must die be put to death

contextId.information: Here "throne" represents the person's power and authority as king. To sit on the throne means to become king. AT: "When he becomes king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: When he sits on the throne of his kingdom

contextId.information: Here "him" represents all the Levites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: has chosen him

contextId.information: Here "the name of Yahweh" stands for Yahweh himself and his authority. AT: "to be his special servants" or "to serve as a representative of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: to stand to serve in the name of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "name" represents Yahweh and his authority. AT: "then he must serve Yahweh his God as a priest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: then he must serve in the name of Yahweh his God

contextId.information: God hates the religious activities of the people in the surrounding nations. He considers them to be terribly evil. Here "nations" represents the people. AT: "you must not do the terrible things that the people of the other nations do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: you must not learn to observe the abominations of those nations

contextId.information: Here "nations" stands for the people groups that live in Canaan. AT: "For these people groups" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: For these nations

contextId.information: Here "words" represent what Yahweh says. Here the metonym "my name" represents Yahweh and his authority. AT: "does not listen to him when he speaks my message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: does not listen to the words of mine that he speaks in my name

contextId.information: Here "name of Yahweh" refers to Yahweh himself and his authority. AT: "a prophet claims to speak for me" or "a prophet claims to speak with my authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: a prophet speaks in the name of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "blood" represents the person who was killed. An "avenger of blood" is a close relative of the person who was killed. This relative is responsible for punishing the murderer. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the avenger of blood

contextId.information: Here "blood" represents a person's life. To shed blood means to kill a person. This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one kills an innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: innocent blood is not shed

contextId.information: Here "the hand" represents the authority of someone. AT: "to the authority of the responsible relative" or "to the responsible relative" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: into the hand of the responsible relative

contextId.information: Here "bloodguilt" represents the guilt for murdering an innocent person. AT: "you must execute the murderer so that the people of Israel will not be guilty for the death of an innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: you must eradicate the bloodguilt from Israel

contextId.information: Here "mouth" represents what the witnesses say. It is implied that there must be at least two or three witnesses. AT: "at the testimony of at least two or three people" or "based on what at least two or three people say happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: at the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses

contextId.information: Here "heart" represents a person's courage. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: brother's heart ... his own heart

contextId.information: Here "it" refers to the city which represents the people. AT: "But if the people of the city do not surrender" or "But if the people of the city do not accept your offer of peace" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: But if it makes no offer of peace

contextId.information: Here "cities" represents the people. AT: "all the people who live in cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: all the cities

contextId.information: Here the metonym "in the name of" refers to Yahweh and his authority. AT: "as one who says and does what Yahweh himself would say and do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in the name of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here the metonym "their word" refers to what the priests say. AT: "because whatever the priests say, that will be the decision" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: for their word will be the verdict

contextId.information: The words "in the eyes of Yahweh" are a metonym for "what Yahweh thinks is right." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what is right in the eyes of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "voice" is a metonym for what a person says. AT: "who will not obey what his father or mother say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: who will not obey the voice of his father or the voice of his mother

contextId.information: Blood is a symbol for death. AT: "so that it will not be the fault of your household if someone dies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: so that you do not bring blood on your house

contextId.information: The words "holy place" is a metonym for the priests who work in the holy place. This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that the priests in Yahweh's holy place do not take away the whole harvest" or "so that you do not defile the whole harvest and the priests do not allow you to use it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that the whole harvest is not confiscated by the holy place

contextId.information: The word "life" is a metonym for what a person needs to keep himself alive. AT: "because he would be taking from the man what the man needs to make food for his family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: for that would be taking a person's life as a pledge

contextId.information: This is a metonym for "what he has promised that he would give you if he did not pay back the loan." Translate as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:24:10|24:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: his pledge

contextId.information: The word "name" is a metonym for the person's family line. AT: "will continue the family line of that man's dead brother" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: will succeed in the name of that man's dead brother

contextId.information: Here "house" is a metonym for the family. AT: "who does not give his brother a son and continue his brother's family line" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: who does not build up his brother's house

contextId.information: This is an idiom, and "Amalek" is a metonym for the Amelikite people. AT: "Remember what the Amalekites did to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Call to mind what Amalek did to you

contextId.information: The word "he" is a metonym for "Jacob's descendants." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: There he became

contextId.information: Here the metonym "tribes" refers to the people from the tribes of Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin. AT: "The people from these tribes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: These tribes

contextId.information: Israelites used a basket to carry grain. A "kneading trough" was a bowl they used to mix the grain and make bread. AT: "all the food you grow and all the food you eat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: your basket and your kneading trough

contextId.information: Here the metonym "voice of Yahweh" means what Yahweh says. AT: "what Yahweh your God is saying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the voice of Yahweh your God

contextId.information: The Israelites used a basket to carry grain. A "kneading trough" was a bowl they used to mix the grain and make bread. Translate as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:05|28:5]]. AT: "all the food you grow and all the food you eat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: your basket and your kneading trough

contextId.information: Here the metonym "strength in your hand" refers to power. "AT: "You will be powerless to do anything about it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: There will be no strength in your hand

contextId.information: The word "nation" is a metonym for the people of that nation. AT: "a nation whose people have fierce expressions, who do not respect the aged and do not show favor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: a nation with a fierce face that does not respect the aged and does not show favor

contextId.information: Here the metonym "name" refers to Yahweh himself. AT: "Yahweh your God who is glorious and awesome" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: this glorious and fearful name, Yahweh your God

contextId.information: The people do have hearts, eyes, and ears. This metonym says that Yahweh has not enabled them to understand from what they saw and heard who Yahweh is, and how and why they should obey him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh has not given you a heart to know, eyes to see, or ears to hear

contextId.information: Here "voice" is referring to what Yahweh says. AT: "obey what he says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: obey his voice

contextId.information: Here "heart" refers to the whole person. This can be stated in active form. AT: "if you stop being loyal to God ... and the people living in the land convince you to bow down and worship other gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: if your heart turns away ... but instead are drawn away and bow down to other gods and worship them

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) Moses is calling on all those who live in heaven and earth to be witnesses to what he says, or 2) Moses is speaking to heaven and earth as if they are people, and he is calling them to be witnesses to what he says (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_apostrophe]])
contextId.quote: I call heaven and earth to witness

contextId.information: "Your life" and "the length of your days" are metonyms for the one who can give life and length of days. You can combine the two phrases if you need to. AT: "Yahweh is the only one who can enable you to live a long life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: For he is your life and the length of your days

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) Moses is calling on all those who live in heaven and earth to be witnesses to what he says or 2) Moses is speaking to heaven and earth as if they are people, and he is calling them to be witnesses to what he says. A similar phrase appears in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:30:19|30:19]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_apostrophe]])
contextId.quote: call heaven and earth to witness against them

contextId.information: Here "the sight of Yahweh" means "in Yahweh's opinion." AT: "because you will do what Yahweh says is evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: because you will do what is evil in the sight of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "hand" represents the strength or power of a person. To be exalted is an idiom for defeating an enemy. AT: "We have defeated them because we are more powerful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Our hand is exalted

contextId.information: This means God is preparing to judge and punish his enemies. AT: "When I sharpen my shining sword" or "When I am ready to judge my enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: When I sharpen my glittering sword

contextId.information: Moses addresses the peoples of all the nations as if they were there listening. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_apostrophe]])
contextId.quote: Rejoice, you nations
